cool.description: Felix is very proud of his new sunglasses case, but keeps calling it his 'staircase'. Another Felixism: instead of 'that plane landed', he says that plane lund. We play planes a lot.
cool.title: Cool

dance.description: Dean and Lucie had a big Friday night, celebrating Chinese New Year at a dance party in San Francisco till the wee hours of the morning and then crashing at a friend's.   The kids?   Felix had a sleepover with Owen, and Maria came to our house for a sleepover with Milo.   Everybody had a fantastic time at their respective events:  even Milo didn't seem perturbed to wake up to Maria instead of Lucie.
dance.title: Dance

dean1.description: Hanging out at Totland, our neighborhood's back yard.
dean1.title: Dean 1

dean2.description: We can't keep Milo away from the water hazard.
dean2.title: Dean 2

lego.description: In a moment of weakness we got Felix yet another Lego castle set.    We're thinking of putting the resulting megacastle in our back yard and renting it out, perhaps to some UC Berkeley student who's tired of dorm life.
lego.title: Lego

playground1.description: The boys chafe at Lucie's sunday driving.
playground1.title: Playground 1

playground2.description: Milo's into soccer in a big way.
playground2.title: Playground 2

playground6.description: He rarely falls over backwards. Just once this week.
playground6.title: Playground 6

tailor.description: Here's a first:  Felix wore a hole in an article of clothing before outgrowing it.   Lucie put a very nice fish patch on the pants.
tailor.title: Tailor

description:
Felix's stories can be wacky. Like the one about the bad guy whose bad gun has a good bullet. Bad guy shoots the gun. The bullet loops back, hits the guy, then hits the gun.

We've been having lots of deep talks with him. Here's part of what transpired after Felix asked what church is.

  • Dean: God? Lots of people believe in a person named God, who lives up in the sky. In Heaven.
  • Felix: Why do lots of people believe in him?
  • Dean: One reason is that they grew up with people that believe in him.
  • Felix: But you don't believe in God?
  • Dean: No.
  • Felix: I believe in God's dog.

Milo passed his 1½ year old checkup with flying colors. Stats: 33.5 inches (85 cm), 24lbs 11oz (11.2kg).

Here's a chart of all of Milo's words and baby signs as of age 1½.
title: January 29
